comments.creator: christophervu@gvtc.com

comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15

I updated several web pages using Leech FTP. Then I open the web page with Internet Explorer 8 and saw the revised version just uploaded. no problem here! I then open Mozilla Firefox 3.6 and it still shows the old version. 

I check the source code from both browsers, IE8 shows the new changes whereas MF3.6 still reads the older version. The actual change was very simple: update a phone number or changing an email address.

How is this possible, given that both browsers' web address is exactly the same, i.e. pointing to the same web page on the server? I have shut down MF and restarted it without any effect.

I would appreciate your opinions. 

My laptop is running Windows 7 Ultimate, 64bit. Intel CPU: i5

Please let me know if you require additional information.

Thanks!

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Edit source code on webpage, by changing a phone number
2.Upload to web server using FTP
3.Run IE to test that page; then run MF to test the same page. 
Actual Results:  
Result: IE reflects the change while MF did not! This is serious if MF was not reading the actual source code but a version of it somewhere else! 

Expected Results:  
both browsers should reflect the change exactly the same way.

I have checked my MF 3.6 to be the latest version!

comments.raw_text:
>Please let me know if you require additional information.
We need the http headers for the old and new documents.

This is usually caused by wrong server headers. WE follow the caching calculation from the http RFCs (AFAIK).
comments.text:
>Please let me know if you require additional information.

This is usually caused by wrong server headers. WE follow the caching calculation from the http RFCs (AFAIK).

comments.raw_text: Maybe the pages where already loaded in FF and SessionRestore just restored the Session/old pages?
comments.author: Tobias.Besemer@Googlemail.com
comments.creator: Tobias.Besemer@Googlemail.com
comments.text: Maybe the pages where already loaded in FF and SessionRestore just restored the Session/old pages?
